alert.note: Alert for Grant (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 5:34AM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in South Dakota... Big Sioux River Near Florence affecting Grant County. .The following river forecasts include forecast precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any additional future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Big Sioux River Near Florence. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, The water reaches the bottom of the bridge 1 mile north of the gauge At 10.0 feet, The water reaches the bottom of the bridge at the gauge and the bridge 2 miles south of the gauge the bridge 1 mile east and 1 1/2 mile north of the gauge is overtopped * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM CDT Wednesday was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon by 245 PM CDT.
